name: Google Vault
description: This app supports the actions to perform eDiscovery and provide a compliance solution for G Suite, allowing customers to retain, hold, search, and export their data

key_json.description: Contents of service account JSON file

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
actions.verbose:
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery.readonly
.

actions.description: List all open, closed, and deleted matters
actions.verbose:
Action uses the Admin SDK API to get a list of matters. Requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery.readonly

The action will limit the number of matters returned to limit or (if not specified) 100.

state.description: Type of matters to be retrieved

limit.description: Maximum number of matters to return

actions.description: Create a matter with OPEN state
actions.verbose:
Action uses the Admin SDK API to create a matter. Requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery
.

example_values: matter is being created for test purpose

actions.description: Fetch information for the given matter ID
actions.verbose:
There are two views of a matter: BASIC (default) and FULL. The FULL view adds matter permissions in addition to the data received in the BASIC view. Requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery.readonly
.

actions.description: Move a matter to the CLOSED state
actions.verbose:
You can close the matter only if it is in the OPEN state. If the matter is in the OPEN state and contains any holds, then, to close the matter all holds must be deleted. For this, you have to checkmark the Delete all holds parameter and run the action. If you keep the parameter unchecked and run the action, it will fail due to undeleted holds in the matter. In that case, the user has to delete all the holds manually; run this action after that to close the matter.
Requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery
.

actions.description: Move a matter to the DELETED state
actions.verbose:
You can delete the matter only if it is in the CLOSED state. If the matter is in the OPEN state and contains any holds, then, to delete it all holds must be deleted and the matter must be moved to the CLOSED state. For this, you have to checkmark the 'Delete all holds' parameter and run the action. By doing this, action will close the matter after deleting all the holds (if any) associated with it and move it to the DELETED state. If you keep the parameter unchecked and run the action, it will fail due to the matter not being in the CLOSED state. In that case, the user has to move the matter to the CLOSED state by manually deleting all the associated holds; run this action after that to delete the matter.
Requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery
.

actions.description: Reopens a matter to move it from CLOSED to OPEN state
actions.verbose:
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery
.

actions.description: Restores a matter to move it from DELETED to CLOSED state
actions.verbose:
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery
.

actions.description: List all holds for the given matter ID
actions.verbose:
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery.readonly

The action will limit the number of holds returned to limit or (if not specified) 100.

limit.description: Maximum number of holds to return

actions.description: Create a hold within the given matter ID
actions.verbose:
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery
.

terms.description: Conditions to be met for a message to be covered by this hold

include_shared_drive_files.description: Include files from associated shared drives

actions.verbose:
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery
.

actions.description: Remove held account from the given hold ID
actions.verbose:
A held account can only be removed from the given hold_id if the search_method of the hold is either USER_ACCOUNT or GROUP_ACCOUNT.
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery
.

example_values: Successfully removed held account to 3z8qrdt111pgr8 hold id for 209366a8-eadc-4687-8d23-190afdfb12ba matter id

actions.description: Add held account to the given hold ID
actions.verbose:
A held account can only be added to the given hold_id if the search_method of the hold is either USER_ACCOUNT or GROUP_ACCOUNT.
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery
.

example_values: Successfully added held account to 3z8qrdt111pgr8 hold id for 209366a8-eadc-4687-8d23-190afdfb12ba matter id

actions.description: List all exports for the given matter ID
actions.verbose:
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery.readonly

The action will limit the number of exports returned to limit or (if not specified) 100.

limit.description: Maximum number of exports to return

actions.description: Get information of an export from the given matter ID
actions.verbose:
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery.readonly
.

actions.description: Perform a search based on the provided criteria and create an export for the search results
actions.verbose:
For ACCOUNT type search_method, you have to provide a valid list of email_ids. For ORG_UNIT type search_method, provide valid org_unit_id. For corpus type GROUPS, you have to select ACCOUNT search method and provide valid list of a group email_ids. The parameter export_format is supported only for the corpus type MAIL and GROUPS. The parameter exclude_drafts is supported only for the corpus type MAIL. The show_confidential_mode_content parameter is supported only for the corpus type MAIL. The parameters include_access_info and include_shared_drives are applicable only for the corpus type DRIVE. UNPROCESSED_DATA data_scope is not supported for corpus type DRIVE. The parameter version_date is only applicable for the corpus type DRIVE. If the corpus type is DRIVE and data scope is HELD_DATA, search_method TEAM_DRIVE is not allowed. Time zone is not applicable for the HELD_DATA data_scope. Terms parameter is not applicable for the UNPROCESSED_DATA data_scope. Google Vault selects the default data_region based on the region assigned to the owner of the matter. You can select one of the values from the United States(US) and Europe(EUROPE) to change the data_region of the created export. Exports are automatically deleted within 15 days of their creation.
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery
.

data_scope.description: Scope of data to be exported

email_ids.description: Comma-separated list of email IDs (user or group)

shared_drive_ids.description: Comma-separated list of shared drive IDs

include_access_info.description: Include access level information for users with indirect access to files (this may increase export duration)

actions.verbose:
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.orgunit.readonly

The action will limit the number of organizations returned to limit or (if not specified) 100.

limit.description: Maximum number of organizations to return

actions.description: List all groups of a domain
actions.verbose:
Action requires authorization with the following scope:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.group.readonly

The action will limit the number of groups returned to limit or (if not specified) 100.

limit.description: Maximum number of groups to return

example_values: Successfully retrieved 5 groups for the domain 'test.com'
